pr_title: Add send list API : send list of messages

timeline.message: Add API: send list of messages

timeline.bodyText: Do you have a test case for the exception scenario where there are too many events
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Why are you chaining.then()? The send operation already returns a mono void.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Why not varargs instead of iterable. I don't remember this in an API view, so I'm curious.
timeline.author: conniey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -135,6 +135,26 @@ public String getEntityPath() {
         return sendInternal(Flux.just(message));
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Sends a list of messages to a Service Bus queue or topic using a batched approach. If the size of messages
+     * exceed the maximum size of a single batch, an exception will be triggered and the send will fail.
+     * By default, the message size is the max amount allowed on the link.
+     *
+     * @param messages Messages to be sent to Service Bus queue or topic.
+     *
+     * @return The {@link Mono} the finishes this operation on service bus resource.
+     *
+     * @throws NullPointerException if {@code messages} is {@code null}.
+     */
+    public Mono<Void> send(Iterable<ServiceBusMessage> messages) {

replies.bodyText: Changed to vargs : This was added by Ramya in last week , I did not had it in API View, We should add just it in API View.
replies.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: Why the assertion here? It's not testing our code

timeline.bodyText: Does message need to be fully qualified

timeline.bodyText:
This return doesn't make sense.
"A Mono that completes when all messages have been sent to the Service Bus resource."
timeline.author: conniey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -136,21 +137,23 @@ public String getEntityPath() {
     }
 
     /**
-     * Sends a message to a Service Bus queue or topic.
+     * Sends an array of messages to a Service Bus queue or topic using a batched approach. If the size of messages
+     * exceed the maximum size of a single batch, an exception will be triggered and the send will fail.
+     * By default, the message size is the max amount allowed on the link.
      *
-     * @param message Message to be sent to Service Bus queue or topic.
-     * @param sessionId the session id to associate with the message.
+     * @param messages Messages to be sent to Service Bus queue or topic.
      *
-     * @return A {@link Mono} the finishes this operation on service bus resource.
+     * @return The {@link Mono} the finishes this operation on service bus resource.

timeline.bodyText: You have to indicate what exception is thrown when the payload exceeds the size of a single batch.

timeline.bodyText: Why wrap this with a stream when you can use a for loop?
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText:
Specify the error that is thrown when the messages are too large for a single batch.
@throws ...
timeline.author: conniey
conniey

timeline.bodyText: Why not for (int i = 0; i < messages.length; i++)? I don't see any added benefit creating this IntStream.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: There's a helper method that does all this: TestUtils.getServiceBusMessages(3, id).toArray()
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Why not for (int i = 0; i < messages.length; i++)? I don't see any added benefit creating this IntStream.

timeline.bodyText: Why not for (int i = 0; i < messages.length; i++)? I don't see any added benefit creating this IntStream.

timeline.bodyText: This should return monoError(logger, new NullPointerException("'messages' cannot be null."); rather than throwing. There are other instances that I need to look at and fix. It's odd when async operations throw instead of returning the terminal error state.
timeline.author: conniey
